abstract.p: Hewlett-Packard Co, in effort to extend its business from office printers to business publishing, says it will invest $100 million in Indigo, Dutch maker of digital color printing systems (S)

block.p: In an effort to extend its business from office printers to business publishing, Hewlett-Packard said yesterday that it would invest $100 million in Indigo, a Dutch maker of digital color printing systems. The move, which a company vice president said was the largest investment that Hewlett's printing division has made in at least 18 months, sent Indigo's American depository receipts soaring 17.6 percent, to $7.7188. Hewlett shares gained $1.25, to $106.25.

Hewlett shares gained $1.25, to $106.25.
